comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: Re Sports Poster - the top line says Gaelic Athletic Association From www.banteerhistory.ie/images/Hillary/1909.pdf Michael O Callaghan Inchemay and Arthur O Sullivan Nadd won All Ireland titles in the All Ireland sports held under GAA rules at Mallow on July 18th 1909. Michael O Callaghan won the four mile flat championship from M. Hourigan Ballingarry 2nd. On the last lap the Banteer man won going exceedingly strong and finished up with plenty to spare. Amid much excitement he received a standing ovation. Arthur O Sullivan won the mile championship from R. Barry Glanworth So looks like your 1909 is correct I would suggest August 1909
